skill.name: benchling-integration
skill.description: Benchling R&D platform integration. Access registry (DNA, proteins), inventory, ELN entries, workflows via API, build Benchling Apps, query Data Warehouse, for lab data management automation.
skill.summary: Benchling R&D platform integration. Access registry (DNA, proteins), inventory, ELN entries, workflo...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill content is documentation with example API usage and SDK patterns. No executable scripts, file access, or network calls are embedded beyond illustrative snippets.

content.value_statement: Manual Benchling data work is slow and error prone. This skill provides clear SDK and REST patterns to automate registry, inventory, ELN, and workflow tasks.
actual_capabilities: Explains API key, OAuth client credentials, and OIDC authentication flows
Shows create, list, update, and archive operations for registry entities
Covers inventory actions for containers, boxes, locations, and transfers
Details ELN entry creation and entity linking
Describes workflow task creation, updates, and async task polling
Lists REST API endpoints, pagination, and error handling patterns
limitations: Requires an active Benchling tenant and valid API credentials
Examples focus on Python SDK and REST patterns only
Does not execute calls or validate live permissions
Data Warehouse usage is described without SQL examples

use_cases.title: Automate registry updates
use_cases.description: Create and update DNA, RNA, or protein records through repeatable SDK calls.

use_cases.title: Track samples and locations
use_cases.description: Create containers and transfer items between boxes and locations with clear steps.

use_cases.title: Extract ELN and workflow data
use_cases.description: List entries and workflow tasks for reporting or downstream analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Start with API key
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to authenticate with an API key and list the first page of DNA sequences.

prompt_templates.title: Create registry entities
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a Python SDK example to create a DNA sequence and register it in a registry.

prompt_templates.title: Inventory transfer
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to transfer a container to a new box and update its volume field.

prompt_templates.title: Workflow task automation
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft steps to create a workflow task, mark it complete, and wait for async task status.

output_examples.input: Explain how to authenticate and list DNA sequences using the SDK.
output: Set BENCHLING_TENANT_URL and BENCHLING_API_KEY in your environment
Initialize the Benchling client with ApiKeyAuth
Call dna_sequences.list and iterate pages to access sequence names and IDs

best_practices: Store credentials in environment variables and rotate keys regularly
Use server side filters and pagination to reduce data transfer
Handle rate limits with retry and backoff strategies
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API keys in source files
Fetching all entities and filtering only on the client

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Benchling tenants?
faq.answer: It requires a Benchling tenant with API access enabled and valid credentials.

faq.question: Are there usage limits I should know?
faq.answer: Benchling enforces rate limits and returns 429 responses when exceeded.

faq.question: Can I integrate with other systems?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill outlines REST patterns suitable for external integrations.

faq.question: How is data safety handled?
faq.answer: It recommends secure credential storage and least privilege access.

faq.question: What should I do if authentication fails?
faq.answer: Verify credentials, permissions, and correct Authorization header format.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual UI work?
faq.answer: The API and SDK enable repeatable automation that scales beyond manual entry.
